text: date: wed 02/02/2000 11:46 am from: stephen skojec (skojec@1st.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: birth control or responsibility control?in the birth control debate, it seems that the question is not whether birth control is a necessary medical resource; it is whether it is an effective commodity that allows us to continue behaving recklessly in a consequence free environment. (" who controls birth control?," 31.jan.2000) the greatest argument on the side of the pro-contraceptive camp is about as weak as their self-gratifying motivation. "people are going to do it anyway, so we need to protect them from the harmful effects of their activity." what humanitarians we have become!try applying this logic to those who insist on behavior that is not politically correct.
